meanings.sent1: After spinning around too fast, she felt the giddiest she had ever felt.
meanings.sent2: The room spun, and she felt the giddiest she had ever been.
meanings.sent3: The giddiest sensation came over her as she twirled in circles.
meanings.sent4: The roller coaster ride left her feeling the giddiest she had ever felt.
meanings.sent5: The sudden drop on the ride made her feel giddiest of all.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of seriousness or stability.
meanings.sent1: His giddiest behavior during the meeting was not appreciated.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't help but giggle at his giddiest antics.
meanings.sent3: The giddiest clown at the circus always made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The giddiest puppy in the litter was always up to mischief.
meanings.sent5: His giddiest expression made it hard to take him seriously.

meanings.definition: To make someone feel dizzy or lightheaded.
meanings.sent1: The spinning teacup ride can giddiest even the bravest souls.
meanings.sent2: Watching the dizzying heights from the ferris wheel can giddiest some people.
meanings.sent3: He tried to giddiest his little sister by spinning her around in circles.
meanings.sent4: The magician's tricks were meant to giddiest the audience.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected plot twist in the movie giddiest the viewers.
